thread.title: Electric shuttle buses: another clean transportation option
thread.title_full: Electric shuttle buses: another clean transportation option

author: PETER FRIED North Jersey Green
title: Electric shuttle buses: another clean transportation option
text:
There are now over 238,000 plug-in electric light-duty vehicles in New Jersey with rapid gains in sedans, compacts, SUVs and pick-ups over the last few years. The end of the federal $7,500 incentive will temporarily damp EV sales. However, dropping prices, fuel savings, increasing range and far less maintenance continue to make them a better financial bet than internal combustion vehicles. Lower emissions are nice too.
However, the number of EV medium-duty trucks is much lower. That will change. It starts with the light and medium duty trucks and busses. EV shuttle busses for local transportation are the best example. With ranges over 100 miles, they easily handle the typical daily routes on one charge, especially in the Northeast. Usually idle overnight, they can be fully charged on less-expensive Level II chargers. They are quieter and pollute less, often important qualities in urban settings. Finally, they have less than one tenth the number of moving parts in the drive train than comparable internal combustion vehicles and this leads to far less required maintenance. Amazon made a huge investment in Rivian delivery trucks and we see them every day. Amazon did not do this purely out of charity.
